<

moves1. e4 c6 2. d4 d5 3. f3continues with3. .. e6 4. Nc3 Bb4provokes white

>-><
5. Ne2
moves 5. .. Ne7 6. a3 Ba5 7. Be3 Nd7 8. Ng3
0-0 with the idea of breaking in the center

>

<
5. Bf4
mainLine
mainline with idea of Qd3 and queenside
castle5. .. Ne7 6. Qd3 b6with the idea to
develop the light squared bishop to a67. Ne2to
intercept attack and exchange on Bf1 so black
resolves the light squared bishop problem.7.
.. Ba6 8. Qe3good position for black where
Nb8 can be easily developed, ligth squared
bishop is active.8. .. 0-0 9. 0-0-0 c5to
attack in the center as white king side
attack is coming.10. a3 Bxc3What does white
recapture with?
>
g.text: mainline with idea of Qd3 and queenside
develop the light squared bishop to a6
intercept attack and exchange on Bf1 so black
resolves the light squared bishop problem.
Nb8 can be easily developed, ligth squared
attack in the center as white king side

g.title:
<
The fantasy variation
moves1. e4 c6 2. d4 d5 3. f3continues with3. .. e6 4. Nc3 Bb4provokes white
PGN file:
fantasy variation
White options after 4. .. Bb4
>-><
5. Bd3 a mistake
looses d4 pawn after exchange on e4 or after
c5 Ne2 looses the bishop
>

<
with the knight 11. Nxc3
After11. .. Bxf1 13. Rxf1c5 pawn could be
defended but13. .. Nc6 14. dxc5 d4Can't
take the knight but can capture c515. Qe2 bxc5
16. Na4 Ng6 17. Bg3 Rc8. white can't capture
on c5 becuase of Qg5+ wins the knight.
Balanced position with good attacking
opportunities for black.
>
g.text: take the knight but can capture c5
on c5 becuase of Qg5+ wins the knight.

5. Bf4

with the knight 11. Nxc3
After11. .. Bxf1 13. Rxf1c5 pawn could be
defended but13. .. Nc6 14. dxc5 d4Can't
take the knight but can capture c515. Qe2 bxc5
16. Na4 Ng6 17. Bg3 Rc8. white can't capture

Balanced position with good attacking

<
with the queen 11. Qxc3
mainLine
mainline11. .. Nd7 12. Bg3 Rc8 13. Kb1 Re8
14. Qd2with the idea of exchange the light
squared bishop on e2 14. .. Bxe2 15. Bxe2 c4
and good attacking opportunities on the queen
side for black
>
g.text: with the idea of exchange the light
squared bishop on e2 14. .. Bxe2 15. Bxe2 c4
and good attacking opportunities on the queen

g.title:
<
5. Bf4
mainLine
mainline with idea of Qd3 and queenside
castle5. .. Ne7 6. Qd3 b6with the idea to
develop the light squared bishop to a67. Ne2to
intercept attack and exchange on Bf1 so black
resolves the light squared bishop problem.7.
.. Ba6 8. Qe3good position for black where
Nb8 can be easily developed, ligth squared
bishop is active.8. .. 0-0 9. 0-0-0 c5to
attack in the center as white king side
attack is coming.10. a3 Bxc3What does white
recapture with?
>-><
with the queen 11. Qxc3
mainLine
mainline11. .. Nd7 12. Bg3 Rc8 13. Kb1 Re8
14. Qd2with the idea of exchange the light
squared bishop on e2 14. .. Bxe2 15. Bxe2 c4
and good attacking opportunities on the queen
side for black
>

<
alternatives to 12. Bg3
12. Bd6to pin the knight, and attack the c5
pawn. Black can unpin the knight with Re8 or
Bc8 if c5 is lost files open up for black to
attack the white king.

12. Kb1 Bb7to attack the e pawn
>

Bc8 if c5 is lost files open up for black to
